description.content: Guide designers through the refreshed Sandbox workflow so lessons stay aligned with automation and facilitation needs.

learning_objectives.content: Translate program insights into Sandbox-aligned lesson objectives.
Storyboard an end-to-end lesson using approved archetypes.
Run the Sandbox generator and package materials for facilitator review.

cover_image.alt: Instructional designers collaborating over journey maps

summary.content: Read each step aloud and pause after slides with lists so teams can log actions.

notes.content: Share this deck with new designers during onboarding and pair it with the Sandbox schema reference.

background_media.alt: Design team planning with laptops and sticky notes

data.subhead: See how briefs become production-ready decks in six focused moves.

overlay_instructions.content: Invite the team to share one challenge they've faced when moving from ideas to Sandbox slides.

card_body.content: **1. Translate the problem** — Align on learner outcomes, constraints, and success signals with program partners.
**2. Curate source material** — Collect texts, media, and prompts; tag assets with their target archetype.
**3. Map the learning arc** — Sequence warmers, skill lifts, and application reps across Sandbox stages.
**4. Draft slide states** — Write JSON-friendly copy, select icons, and confirm modifier choices per archetype.
**5. Prototype the deck** — Run the generator, review navigation, and capture UX or accessibility gaps.
**6. Prepare handoff** — Bundle facilitator notes, assets, and QA checklists for review.

footnote.content: Pin this sequence near your workspace; each slide ahead expands on a critical move.

body.content: Synthesize interviews, diagnostics, and exemplar work. Call out tensions and opportunities.
Write measurable learner statements linked to badges or progression markers.
Confirm priorities with program partners and note any non-negotiables for delivery.
Block time, facilitation moves, and group modes so the arc stays focused.

text.content: Pair each stage with a Sandbox archetype so designers, developers, and facilitators share a visual contract.

items.content: **Warm-up** → `hero.overlay` or `centered.callout` to surface context and activate prior knowledge.
**Skill lift** → `card.stack` or `content.wrapper` to unpack models, criteria, and mentor moves.
**Application** → `interactive.activity-card` or token boards for collaborative practice.
**Closure** → `pill.card-stack` or `dialogue.stack` to synthesize learning and commit to next steps.

text.content: Document modifier selections (e.g., centered alignment, stack density) next to each slide so QA can spot layout drift.
Build a quick table mapping slide slug → archetype → objective reference. This keeps automation exports tidy.

card_body.content: **Validate JSON** with the lesson schema lint script before rendering.
**Run spot checks** for navigation, keyboard traps, and copyfit on long cards.
**Capture feedback** directly in the JSON using comments or adjacent notes for the next sprint.

text.content: Package everything facilitators and QA reviewers need before you archive the sprint.

items.content: Attach facilitator annotations, run-of-show timing, and equipment lists.
Share resolved media assets with alt text plus any outstanding placeholder tickets.
Log pilot insights and next experiments in the release notes field.

text.content: Schedule a retro with design, facilitation, and research to capture glow/grow moments for the next iteration.
